meanings.definition: To make a hole or groove in something by digging or scraping.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel was gouging the acorn out of the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: She was gouging the clay to create a sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The kids were gouging the sand at the beach to build a sandcastle.
meanings.sent4: The roots of the tree were gouging deep into the ground for stability.
meanings.sent5: The artist was gouging intricate patterns into the wood with a chisel.

meanings.definition: To charge an exorbitant price for something.
meanings.sent1: The store was gouging customers by selling water bottles at high prices during the heatwave.
meanings.sent2: The gas station was gouging customers by raising the fuel prices overnight.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream truck driver was gouging kids by selling small cones for a fortune.
meanings.sent4: The hotel was gouging tourists by charging double the usual rate during the holiday season.
meanings.sent5: The taxi driver was gouging passengers by taking longer routes to increase the fare.
